qas.question: Most institutes of technology in Thailand were born out of what other type of institutions?
What type of degree were Thailand's technical colleges historically not allowed to confer?
What's the new name of Pathumwan Technical School?

context: Most of Thailand's institutes of technology were developed from <a0_0>technical colleges<a0_0/>, in the past could not grant <a1_0>bachelor's degrees<a1_0/>; today, however, they are university level institutions, some of which can grant degrees to the doctoral level. Examples are <a2_0>Pathumwan Institute of Technology<a2_0/> (developed from Pathumwan Technical School), King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang (Nondhaburi Telecommunications Training Centre), and King Mongkut's Institute of Technology North Bangkok (Thai-German Technical School).
